titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. George Oakes, Judgment
CWG4764

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Kenton Circuit Court
December Term Decr 30th 1863
Commonwealth agst Geo oakes No 771 Indictment

Came the parties and Defendant plead not Guilty thereupon came a Jury viz Robt Howe, Moses Suincy, Lewis Keene, H Drexelins, F P Martin, Jas March, A J Gray, W H Glore, Jas Bryant, J. L. Eubank, C Hennbrook, Jas. Spillman, who being duly sworn well and truly to try the issue, after hearing the evidence returned the following virdict. We the Jury find the Defendant Guilty as charged in the indictment. Robt Howe, foreman. Whereupon it is adjudged that Defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth of Ky in the sum of $6000 and the costs herein expended and that a caprias pro fine issue on said Judgment

Copy att B W Foley Clerk
By Joe P Haul D C

No 771
Kenton Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against } Indictment for keeping of Tippling house
George Oakes Deft.
The Grand Jury of Kenton County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse George Oakes. of the offence of Keeping a tippling house, committed as follows viz.

The said George Oakes in the County Circuit and State aforesaid on the day of September 1863. and on divers other days and times before and since that time did then and there Keep a Tippling house. contrary to the statute in each case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky.

R. B. Carpenter
Commonwalths Atty of Kentucky

Witnesses
J Hampton
W D Euncy
Ellison Davis
